title: Android Auto’s Library is About to Get Even More Expansive
description: Fight off boredom during rest stops. The post Android Auto’s Library is About to Get Even More Expansive appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: Fight off boredom during rest stops.
text: A while back, Google announced that it was working with developers on integrating “car ready” apps within its Android Auto platform, which gives users access to a wide selection of software and entertainment services while their vehicle is parked. With that in mind, Google recently confirmed that it was beginning this massive app rollout, starting with select car models. READ: Google Sneakily Adds in UI Changes to Android Auto This includes streaming services, interactive software and games, and more. Part of Google’s official statement reads: Starting this week, cars with Google built-in will get dozens of new apps to enjoy while parked. This launch is part of our car ready mobile apps program, which we introduced last year to make it easier for developers to distribute their large-screen-optimized mobile apps to car screens. Whether you’re waiting at a charging station or in line at school pickup, you’ll be able to stay entertained with popular streaming and gaming apps like Farm Heroes Saga and F1 TV… Google hasn’t specified all the car models that will receive this update, although the launch will be initially available for select cars from Polestar and Volvo, with more to follow soon. A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart. html:
A while back, Google announced that it was working with developers on integrating “car ready” apps within its Android Auto platform, which gives users access to a wide selection of software and entertainment services while their vehicle is parked. With that in mind, Google recently confirmed that it was beginning this massive app rollout, starting with select car models.

READ: Google Sneakily Adds in UI Changes to Android Auto

This includes streaming services, interactive software and games, and more. Part of Google’s official statement reads:

Starting this week, cars with Google built-in will get dozens of new apps to enjoy while parked.

This launch is part of our car ready mobile apps program, which we introduced last year to make it easier for developers to distribute their large-screen-optimized mobile apps to car screens.

Whether you’re waiting at a charging station or in line at school pickup, you’ll be able to stay entertained with popular streaming and gaming apps like Farm Heroes Saga and F1 TV…

Google hasn’t specified all the car models that will receive this update, although the launch will be initially available for select cars from Polestar and Volvo, with more to follow soon.

A writer and content creator with a love for tech and music, Mike is also an avid gamer as well. He and his wife are big fans of Mario Kart.
